thread.title: College rewind: Hope, GVSU VB both sweep; Hope women's golf tied for 1st at MIAA Tourney
thread.title_full: College rewind: Hope, GVSU VB both sweep; Hope women's golf tied for 1st at MIAA Tourney

author: Staff reports
title: College rewind: Hope, GVSU VB both sweep; Hope women's golf tied for 1st at MIAA Tourney
text: Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 11:51 PM Updated Oct 9, 2015 at 11:51 PM By Staff reports Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 11:51 PM Holland, Mich. Volleyball Hope sweeps Albion The Hope College volleyball team swept Albion with a 25-20, 25-14, 25-14 win at DeVos Fieldhouse on Friday. The 14th-ranked Flying Dutch (13-4 overall, 8-1 MIAA) pushed their win streak to six matches behind 46 kills as a team. They entered the match with the second-highest average in the nation at 14.38 kills per set. Sarah Feldpausch had a match-high 14 kills and Haley Muller added 10 kills and Lauren Hazekamp directed the Flying Dutch with 31 assists and had 12 digs. Lakers sink Lake Erie The Grand Valley State scored a 3-0 victory (25-18, 25-10, 25-16) at Lake Erie on Friday. The win is GVSU's ninth 3-0 sweep of the season, putting the Lakers to 7-1 in GLIAC play and 11-5 overall. Grand Valley State has swept five of its eight conference opponents. Soccer GVSU women blank Ashland The Grand Valley State women's soccer team beat the previously undefeated No. 21 Ashland Eagles in a 5-0 shutout Friday. The Lakers earned their fourth road win of the season in strong fashion, improving to 11-1-o overall and 7-0-0 i the GLIAC. Cross Country Hope men fifth, women event at Invite The Hope College men's cross country team finished fifth with 171 points and the women seventh with 198 points at the Lansing Community College Invitational on Friday. Golf Hope women tied for 1st at MIAA Tourney The Hope College women's golf team is 18 holes away from the eighth Michigan Intercollegiate Athletic Association championship in team history and the second in a row. The Flying Dutch tied for first Friday during the first round of the MIAA's season-ending tournament and extended their overall lead to 24 strokes. Hope's team score of 325 at Bedford Valley Country Club in Battle Creek put the Flying Dutch 24 strokes ahead of second-place Olivet and 28 up on third-place Saint Mary's after five rounds. Tomorrow's final round tees off at 10 a.m. Britni Gielow carded the low round among 53 golfers by shooting a season-best, 3-over-par 75. She took over the lead in the race for seasonal medalist. Megan Klintworth chipped in a second-place 78, Nicole Meyer fired an 80 to tie for seventh place, Megan Wierenga shot a 92 and Morgan Leep shot a 93. The top four teams this fall advance to the MIAA's NCAA Division III Championships qualifier. The league champion hosts the final two rounds of the 54-hole, three-day event. By Staff reports
